titles.title: Requiring the display of the Ten Commandments in the United States Capitol.
Requiring the display of the Ten Commandments in the United States Capitol.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

term.name: Civil Rights and Liberties, Minority Issues

bill.summary: States that the Ten Commandments are a declaration of the fundamental principles that are the cornerstone of a fair and just society. Requires a copy of them to be prominently displayed in the U.S. Capitol at such place and in such manner as the Architect of the Capitol shall designate.
